function _interopRequireDefault(obj) { return obj && obj.__esModule ? obj : { default: obj }; }

Calls the asynchronous function fn with a callback parameter that allows it to call itself again, in series, indefinitely.

If an error is passed to the callback then errback is called with the error, and execution stops, otherwise it will never be called.

Params
fn AsyncFunction
  • an async function to call repeatedly. Invoked with (next).
[errback] Function
  • when fn passes an error to it's callback, this function will be called, and execution stops. Invoked with (err).
 
function forever(fn, errback) {
    var done = (0, _onlyOnce2.default)(errback || _noop2.default);
    var task = (0, _wrapAsync2.default)((0, _ensureAsync2.default)(fn));

    function next(err) {
        if (err) return done(err);
        task(next);
    }
    next();
}
module.exports = exports['default'];
